comments:
Hi,

  I've set up a brand new Jira installation (version 3.7-#184 Entreprise) and I wanna give a try to Mylar.

  I've installed the plugin with jira support only.

  When I create a repository, I select Jira on the first screen,
on the next screen here is the input i've set (without single quote): 

server   : 'jira.domain.com'
label    : 'jira.domain.com'
userid   : login
password : pwd
Character Encoding : default UTF8

When I hit the "validate setting" button, I've a success notification telling that the server was found and authentificatin is successfull.

BUT the finish button is still disabled!

If I add http:// at the start of the server input to get 'http://jira.domain.com' the button finish is enabled

BUT

when I validate settings again or try to browse the repository

I've got an exception : 

org.tigris.jira.core.service.exceptions.ServiceUnavailableException: Bad envelope tag:  html
at org.tigris.jira.internal.core.service.soap.SoapJiraService$StandardLoginToken.getCurrentValue(SoapJiraService.java:575)
at org.tigris.jira.internal.core.service.soap.SoapJiraService.getServerInfo(SoapJiraService.java:159)
at org.tigris.jira.core.service.CachedRpcJiraServer.initializeServerInfo(CachedRpcJiraServer.java:409)
at org.tigris.jira.core.service.CachedRpcJiraServer.getServerInfo(CachedRpcJiraServer.java:458)
at org.tigris.jira.core.service.CachedRpcJiraServer.initializeProjects(CachedRpcJiraServer.java:192)
at org.tigris.jira.core.service.CachedRpcJiraServer.refreshDetails(CachedRpcJiraServer.java:117)
at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.jira.core.JiraServerFacade.refreshServerSettings(JiraServerFacade.java:117)
at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.jira.core.JiraRepositoryConnector.updateAttributes(JiraRepositoryConnector.java:315)
at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.tasks.ui.views.ResetRepositoryConfigurationAction$1.run(ResetRepositoryConfigurationAction.java:65)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)


It's sad... I can't try Mylar :'(

Regards,
Manson Thomas

In case of jira, server field should be pointing to the service entry point on your jira server. For example 

  http://opensource.atlassian.com/projects/spring 
  http://developer.atlassian.com/jira
  http://jira.codehaus.org

Manson: if Eugene's pointer doesn't resolve this for you, please take a look at the FAQ: http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/Mylar_FAQ#JIRA_Connector

If that still does not resolve the problem please reopen this bug.

Oops my mistake...

I didn't active rpc api call in jira.

However, when server was 'jira.domain.com', the validation settings button tells that it was working whereas rpc api call was desactivated.

And the "bad html enveloppe" message should be change to something clearer like 'Can't connect, check RPC API activation in jira' or at least display the html error code to match the FAQ ;)

Thanks for help,
I can now try Mylar :o)

Regards,
Manson Thomas.
